Parameter.Name: Configuration
Parameter.Description: Root node of the configuration file.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General
Parameter.Description: Contains the general parameters of the Cloud Gateway Storage Manager process.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/ProvidersPath
Parameter.Description: Path to the Storage Provider plugins directory.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/FiltersPath
Parameter.Description: Path to the Storage Filter plugins directory.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/DBBackendsPath
Parameter.Description: Path to the Database plugins directory.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/CommunicationSocket
Parameter.Description: Path to the Unix Socket used to communicate with the various Cloud Gateway Fuse components. The Cloud Gateway Storage Manager process needs creation, read and write access to this file.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/PidFile
Parameter.Description: Path to the file where the Cloud Gateway Storage Manager process will write its Process ID. Creation and write access to this file is needed to the Storage Manager process.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/LogFile
Parameter.Description: Path to the file where the Cloud Gateway Storage Manager process will write its log messages when needed. Creation and write access to this file is needed to the Storage Manager process.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/MonitorInformationsPath
Parameter.Description: Path to the POSIX shared memory object used for the sharing of Storage Providers status between the Cloud Gateway Storage Manager processes. This path should be a string up to NAME_MAX (i.e., 255) characters consisting of an initial slash, followed by one or more characters, none of which are slashes.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/StatsJSONFile
Parameter.Description: Path to the JSON file that the Stats process will write statistics informations to.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/CleanerDBSlots
Parameter.Description: Maximum number of simultaneous database connections that the Cleaner process will be able to obtain.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/CleanerDelay
Parameter.Description: Time in seconds between two passes of the cleaning process.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/SyncerDBSlots
Parameter.Description: Maximum number of simultaneous database connections that the Syncer process will be able to obtain.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/SyncerDelay
Parameter.Description: Time in seconds between two passes of the syncing process.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/SyncerDirtynessDelay
Parameter.Description: Should match the CloudFuse Configuration/DirtynessDelay parameter.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/SyncerMaxDBObjectsPerCall
Parameter.Description: Maximum number of objects the Storage Manager Syncer process will request in each DB call.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/Daemonize
Parameter.Description: Whether the Cloud Gateway Storage Manager should act as a daemon in the background, as opposed to stay in the foreground.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/HTTPConnectionsCacheSize
Parameter.Description: Maximum amount of simultaneously open connections that each Storage Manager process may cache. A value of 0 means no limit.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/HTTPMaxConnectionsByHost
Parameter.Description: Maximum amount of simultaneously open connections that each Storage Manager process may open to a single host (based on the hostname). A value of 0 means no limit.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/HTTPMaxConcurrentConnections
Parameter.Description: Maximum amount of simultaneously open connections that each Storage Manager process may have in total. A value of 0 means no limit.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/HTTPCABundleFile
Parameter.Description: Path to the file holding one or more certificates to verify the HTTP SSL/TLS peers with. The special value 'None' may be needed on some system to disable the use of this file.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/HTTPCABundlePath
Parameter.Description: Path to the directory holding one or more certificates hash to verify the HTTP SSL/TLS peers with. The special value 'None' may be needed on some system to disable the use of this directory.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/General/SyncerDumpHTTPStates
Parameter.Description: Dump Curl HTTP states during each Syncer run.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Monitor
Parameter.Description: Contains the parameters related to the monitoring of Cloud Storage Instances.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Monitor/Delay
Parameter.Description: Delay in seconds between two checks of the same Cloud Storage Instance.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Monitor/FileSize
Parameter.Description: The size in bytes of the file sent to and retrieved from the Cloud Storage Instance in order to check that everything is working fine.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Monitor/FileId
Parameter.Description: The identifier used at the Cloud Storage Provider for the test file. This needs to be a valid file name for the Storage Provider API for each monitored Instance.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Monitor/FileTemplatePath
Parameter.Description: Path to the directory where the Monitor component may create temporary files, with a size up to Configuration/Monitor/FileSize and a number of temporary files up to the number of different Storage Instances. The Cloud Gateway Storage Manager needs read and write access to this directory.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Monitor/FileDigest
Parameter.Description: Algorithm used to compute the test file's digest before and after storage at the Storage Provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/DB
Parameter.Description: Contains the parameters related to the database server.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/DB/Type
Parameter.Description: Database type.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/DB/Specifics/ConnectionString
Parameter.Context: PostgreSQL Database server
Parameter.Description: A valid PostgreSQL connection string. If Configuration/DB/Specifics/ReadOnlyConnectionString is set, this connection string is used either only for write statements. Otherwise, it is used for all statements.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/DB/Specifics/ReadOnlyConnectionString
Parameter.Context: PostgreSQL Database server
Parameter.Description: A valid PostgreSQL connection string, used only for read-ony (aka SELECT) statements. Write statements are done using the Configuration/DB/Specifics/ConnectionString connection string.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/DB/Specifics/PoolSize
Parameter.Context: PostgreSQL Database server
Parameter.Description: Number of connections in the connection pool.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/DB/Specifics/ConnectionRetry
Parameter.Context: PostgreSQL Database server
Parameter.Description: Number of connections retry attempts.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Name
Parameter.Description: Name of this instance.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Provider
Parameter.Description: The instance's storage provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/CheckObjectHash
Parameter.Context: An instance using an Amazon S3 or an Openstack Swift Provider
Parameter.Description: Whether to check the hash returned by the provider, if any, when uploading or downloading an object. This option has non negligeable costs in terms of CPU processing time and memory usage, but is a very effective way to protect file integrity.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/HttpTimeout
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: Maximum time in seconds allowed before cancelling an HTTP request. Default is 0, which means no limit, except the underlying OS timeouts for TCP connections.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/HttpSSLCiphersSuite
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description:
List of ciphers availables for TLS connections. More information can be found at the following address:
https://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/SSLClientCertificateFile
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The full path of a file containing a X.509 client certificate in PEM format, which will be used for SSL/TLS client certificate authentication if the server requires it. You will also need to configure the SSLClientCertificateKeyFile directive.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/SSLClientCertificateKeyFile
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The full path of a file containing the key in PEM format corresponding to the X.509 client certificate specified with the SSLClientCertificateFile directive. If the key is password-protected, you will need to set the SSLClientCertificateKeyPassword directive. Otherwise, the entire Storage Manager could be blocked, waiting for the key to be entered.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/SSLClientCertificateKeyPassword
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: If the key present in the SSLClientCertificateKeyFile file is password-protected, this directive should contain the password needed to unlock the key, in plaintext.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/MaxSingleUploadSize
Parameter.Description: The maximum size of a file to be uploaded in a single operation. File larger than this size will be uploaded using the multipart/segmented API of the provider when applicable.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/MaxUploadSpeed
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The maximum speed of a single upload, in bytes per second. If a transfer exceeds this value on cumulative average, it will be paused to keep the average rate below the value. 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/MaxDownloadSpeed
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The maximum speed of a single download, in bytes per second. If a transfer exceeds this value on cumulative average, it will be paused to keep the average rate below the value. 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/LowSpeedLimit
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The transfer speed in bytes per second that the transfer should be below during LowSpeedTime seconds in order to be considered too slow and aborted. 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/LowSpeedTime
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The time in seconds that a transfer should be below the LowSpeedLimit in order to be considered too slow and aborted. 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Verbose
Parameter.Description: Whether to log HTTP and HTTPS transaction. This option is useful for debugging purpose, but must be used with caution. It will write a lot of informations to disk, including confidential ones, may cause huge disk I/Os and even fill the disk entirely.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/ShowHTTPRequests
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: Whether to log HTTP and HTTPS requests and their result. This option is useful for debugging purpose, and logs more readable, less verbose informations that the Verbose option.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Disable100Continue
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: Whether to disable the use of the Expect: 100-continue header, in case the server does not support it.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/DisableTCPFastOpen
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: Whether to disable the use of TCP Fast Open, in case the server does not deal correctly with it.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/HttpUserAgent
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: The HTTP User-Agent used for all HTTP requests made for this instances.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/AllowInsecureHTTPS
Parameter.Context: An instance using an HTTP-based storage provider, like Amazon S3 or Openstack Swift
Parameter.Description: Whether to allow this instance to connect to a server providing an invalid X.509 certificate. This can be useful for an internal, private cloud without a valid certificate. This should not be enabled if you are not really sure of what you are doing.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/AccessKeyId
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Amazon S3 Provider
Parameter.Description: The Access Key ID provided by the S3 provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/SecretAccessKey
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Amazon S3 Provider
Parameter.Description: The Secret Access Key provided by the S3 provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Endpoint
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Amazon S3 Provider
Parameter.Description:
The S3 endpoint of this specific instance WITHOUT the bucket name. See for example
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#s3_region
for more informations.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/EndpointPath
Parameter.Context: An instance using the S3 Provider
Parameter.Description: The path part of the uniform ressource locator of the S3 endpoint of this specific instance.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/EndpointPort
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Amazon S3 Provider
Parameter.Description: The S3 endpoint TCP port of this specific instance. Use 80 for HTTP (Set SecureTransaction to false) and 443 for HTTPS (Set SecureTransaction to true).

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/SecureTransaction
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Amazon S3 Provider
Parameter.Description: Whether to use Transport Layer Security (HTTPS) while connecting to the S3 endpoint of this specific instance. Use false for HTTP (Set EndpointPort to 80) and true for HTTPS (Set EndpointPort to 443). Please be aware that this option has non negligeable costs in terms of CPU processing time and memory usage. If you want to protect the confidentiality of your files, we strongly advise to set this option to true.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Bucket
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Amazon S3 Provider
Parameter.Description: The name of the S3 bucket to use for this instance.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/IdentityVersion
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: The version of the identity method used by the provider. v1.0 is used by Rackspace, v2.0, also known as Keystone, is used by most of the others providers. v1.0 requires a username and an API access key, whereas v2.0 requires a username, password and a tenant id or a tenant name.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/AuthenticationFormat
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider, with identity version 2
Parameter.Description: Experimental. Set the format used to send the credentials to the Openstack Keystone server.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Username
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: The user name provided by your Openstack provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Password
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider, with identity version 2.
Parameter.Description: The password provided by your Openstack provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/TenantId
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider, with identity version 2
Parameter.Description: The tenant ID provided by your Openstack provider. Identity version 2 requires a valid tenant ID or a valid tenant name.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/TenantName
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider, with identity version 2.
Parameter.Description: The tenant name provided by your Openstack provider. Identity version 2 requires a valid tenant ID or a valid tenant name.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/APIAccessKey
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider, with identiy version 1
Parameter.Description: The API Access Key provided by your Openstack provider. Required for identity 1.0.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/AuthenticationEndpoint
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: The Authentication Endpoint provided by your Openstack provider.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/Container
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: The name of the Openstack container to use for this instance.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/PreferredRegion
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: The object-store preferred region to use if the Openstack provider provides more than one.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/AuthenticationMaxLifetime
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: The maximum lifetime of an authentication token, in seconds.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Specifics/AuthenticationTokenRecentDelay
Parameter.Context: An instance using the Openstack Provider
Parameter.Description: An authentication error with a token older than this delay will trigger a re-authentication.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Type
Parameter.Description: The name of the Cloud Storage Filter to apply before sending files to the Cloud Storage Provider, and after retrieving them. This encryption filter provides an acceptable level of confidentiality, as neither the Cloud Storage Provider nor any intermediary will have access to a unencrypted version of the file. The compression filter is not available for S3 providers like Amazon, it will be ignored if it is set.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Enabled
Parameter.Description: Whether to active the corresponding filter or not. This option allows to keep all the filter configuration options in the active configuration file even if the filter is currently disabled.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Cipher
Parameter.Context: Encryption filter
Parameter.PossibleValues: aes-128-cbc, aes-192-cbc, aes-256-cbc, aes-128-ctr, aes-192-ctr, aes-256-ctr, bf-cbc, camellia-128-cbc, camellia-192-cbc, camellia-256-cbc
Parameter.Description: The symmetric cipher algorithm to use. The cipher algorithm used has a huge impact in terms of processing time.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Digest
Parameter.Context: Encryption filter
Parameter.Description: The message digest to use to derive an encryption key (and an IV) based on the user-submitted password (see Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Password), the key iteration count (see Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/KeyIterationCount), and a randomly generated salt.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/KeyIterationCount
Parameter.Context: Encryption filter
Parameter.Description: The count of key iterations used to derive an encryption key (and IV) based on the user-submitted password (see Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Password) and a randomly generated salt. An higher Key Iteration Count parameter increase the difficulty of performing a brute force attack against the password, but equally slows down the key generation process.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Password
Parameter.Context: Encryption filter
Parameter.Description: The password from which is derived the encryption key (and IV). See also Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/KeyIterationCount and Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Digest. Warning: if this password is lost, encrypted files will be lost forever.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/Instances/Instance/Filters/Filter/Specifics/Level
Parameter.Context: Compression filter
Parameter.Description: The compression level, from 1 to 9, 1 being the fastest and 9 the most efficient, albeit the slowest and more memory consuming.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/Id
Parameter.Description: The name of this filesystem.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/Type
Parameter.Description: The type of filesystem. A value other than single is only relevant for a filesystem using two or more instances.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/CacheRoot
Parameter.Description: An existing directory under which Cloud Gateway Storage Manager will store cached files. This directory should be readable and writable, and should have at least twice the size of the biggest file used on this filesystem available.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/FullThreshold
Parameter.Description: The minimum free space, in percent, that the filesystem containing the CacheRoot directory should have in order not to be considered as dangerously full. If this threshold is reached, the Cloud Gateway Storage Manager Cleaner process will be executed in order to regain space by deleting old unused files present in cache.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/IOBlockSize
Parameter.Description: The filesystem preferred I/O block size. Default depends on the operating system page size.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/AutoExpunge
Parameter.Description: This option instructs the Storage Manager to expunge an entry from the cache as soon as it has been synced to all the mirrored storage providers.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/InodeDigestAlgorithm
Parameter.PossibleValues: none, md5, ripemd160, sha1, sha256, sha512, whirlpool
Parameter.Description: The filesystem inode digest algorithm. This digest is computed before uploading the inode content, stored in the database and checked when the inode content is downloaded.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/CleanMinFileSize
Parameter.Description: The minimum file size in bytes for an object to be considered by the cache cleaning process. Default is 0.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/CleanMaxAccessOffset
Parameter.Description: Only files that have been not been accessed for at least this value (in seconds) might be cleaned. Default is 86400. A value under 60 will be rounded up to 60.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/Instances/Instance
Parameter.Description: Instance name of one instance used by this filesystem. If more that one instance is used by a filesystem, the filesystem type (Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/Type) determines how each instance will be used.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/MountPoint
Parameter.Description: The directory where the filesystem should be mounted.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/ConnectionsPoolSize
Parameter.Description: The maximum number of cached connections to the storage manager.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/MaxConnectionIdleTime
Parameter.Description: How long, in seconds, can a cached connection remain idle. 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/MaxRequestsPerConnection
Parameter.Description: The maximum number of requests that can be served over the same connection. 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/RetryCount
Parameter.Description: How many times we reset a request and try again in case of error.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/DirtynessDelay
Parameter.Description: The FUSE component notify the Storage Manager about write() operation done to a file, at most every dirtyness delay seconds.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/NameMax
Parameter.Description: The maximum length of a pathname component, 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/PathMax
Parameter.Description: The maximum length of a path, 0 means unlimited.

Parameter.Name: Configuration/FileSystems/FileSystem/DirIndexLimit
Parameter.Description: Store an in-memory hash table to list entries in directory to have better performance when there is more than DirIndexLimit entries.
